column4: I have Ubuntu 12.04, and I'd like to have a separate launcher and separate place where I can access programs that I have opened
Are there any good solutions to this? I had a quick glance of Apple OS X way of handling launcher, I liked that
dash stores recent files and apps you have used..
sure, but I'd like to have a nice, clear launcher that's either overview of all programs installed or overview of select few programs I might want to use
like so: http://www.linuxnov.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/02/Dash-Home-Unity-5.2-Ubuntu-12.04-LTS-Precise-Pangolin.png
you are describing dash, the 2nd icon at the bottom shows all the installed apps, the first are the recent apps and files..
there is gnomedo I guess
6 partially random programs with 2 clicks is not good enough. I'd want to have a selection of 10+ programs with 1 click
those are the recent programs, not random at all
whatever you use it will be 2 clicks or a press and a click, think about it
or you can press ALT+F2 and type app names
win button seems a lot easier
anything you use will need 2 clicks though, one to initiate the selector, and the next to select, so how you get 2 clicks being not good enough is a mystery.

with launcher as it is, you can have any program on launcher with 1 click. Also, the limitation of there being only 6 programs is a serious one, and the final nail to that coffin is how the list of programs displayed is not customizable
you can add apps to the launcher as you need
you can slide it up and down and selct what you need and the launchers will compress etc
that is true, but i want to separate launcher and open window manager
I don't think that is possible, you could add a dock
you could add a dock like AWN or docky, you can't get another Unity launcher
I'd like to get rid of Unity Launcher, actually
you could enable the scale compiz plugin and use a hot cornet like Mac does to show all windows
you could install Xubuntu instead then run a tonne of docks, one for each desktop side
